title: PublicTechnology - AI Firms Must Address Hallucinations Before GOV.UK Chatbot Can Roll Out
description: Real-world account of GOV.UK Chat pilot finding that even 1% hallucination rate—where chatbot becomes confrontational, abusive, or 'seductive'—prevents widespread deployment. Demonstrates that technical excellence isn't enough; edge cases matter critically in government contexts.

title: Frost Brown Todd - AI Chatbots, Hallucinations, and Legal Risks
description: Legal analysis of Air Canada tribunal case where chatbot hallucinated bereavement policy, creating legally binding contract. Covers mitigation strategies including policy links, disclosure requirements, and data integrity checks essential for government deployment.

title: Business Standard - Deloitte's AI Fiasco: Why Chatbots Hallucinate and Who Else Got Caught
description: Recent case of Australian government receiving $440K report with fabricated references and invented quotes. Led to partial refund and demonstrates accountability challenges when AI-generated content enters official processes without adequate review.

title: Open Data Institute (ODI) - A Framework for AI-Ready Data
description: Defines AI-readiness principles and specific criteria for data publishers to make datasets AI-ready from publication. Addresses how poor quality data drives costs, biased data affects model performance, and uninspected evaluation datasets lead to false accuracy estimates. Provides actionable framework based on literature review, expert interviews, and ODI's decade of data practice experience for assessing and improving dataset publishing.

title: Solutions Review - An Example AI Readiness in Government Assessment Framework
description: Government-specific readiness framework emphasizing transparency by default, explainability as democratic accountability requirement, and vendor vetting. Highlights that government AI must optimize for fairness and long-term societal impact, not just speed or scale.

title: ICMA - Your AI Readiness Assessment Checklist
description: Public sector-focused checklist covering opportunity discovery, data management, IT environment/security, risk/privacy/governance, and adoption. Addresses unique challenges of aging technology systems and ethical concerns in government contexts.
